>=0.6.0;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol\";\n\n/// @title TokenHelper\n/// @notice Contains helper methods for interacting with ERC20 tokens that do not consistently return true/false\nlibrary ERC20Helper {\n    /// @notice Transfers tokens from msg.sender to a recipient\n    /// @dev Calls transfer on token contract, errors with TF if transfer fails\n    /// @param token The contract address of the token which will be transferred\n    /// @param to The recipient of the transfer\n    /// @param value The value of the transfer\n    function safeTransfer(address token, address to, uint256 value) internal {\n        require(token != address(0), \"ERC20: Nil address\");\n        require(Address.isContract(token), \"ERC20: EOA provided\");\n        (bool success, bytes memory data) = token.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(IERC20.transfer.selector, to, value));\n        require(success && (data.length == 0 || abi.decode(data, (bool))), \"Interaction with the spot token failed.\");\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Transfers tokens from msg.sender to a recipient\n    /// @dev Calls transfer on token contract, errors with TF if transfer fails\n    /// @param token The contract address of the token which will be transferred\n    /// @param from The sender of the transfer\n    /// @param to The recipient of the transfer\n    /// @param value The value of the transfer\n    function safeTransferFrom(address token, address from, address to, uint256 value) internal {\n        require(token != address(0), \"ERC20: Nil address\");\n        require(Address.isContract(token), \"ERC20: EOA provided\");\n        (bool success, bytes memory data) = token.call(\n            abi.encodeWithSelector(IERC20.transferFrom.selector, from, to, value)\n        );\n        require(success && (data.length == 0 || abi.decode(data, (bool))), \"ERC20: Insufficent balance or approval\");\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x35e6581c774d4de3c2fa33be1170133671ab37604bca51b0ee2863c682d05c7f","license":"MIT"},"contracts/IPBM.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n/// @title Purpose-Bound Money (PBM) Interface\n/// @notice The PBM interface facilitates logical constraints on the use of ERC-20 tokens by acting as a wrapper around them.\ninterface IPBM {\n    struct UserBalance {\n        uint256 walletBalance;\n        uint256 availableBalance;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Initializes the contract with the address of the underlying ERC20 token, contract expiration, and the PBM address list.\n    /// @param _spotToken The address of the underlying ERC20 token.\n    /// @param _expiry Global expiry timestamp for the contract.\n    function initialise(address _spotToken, uint256 _expiry) external;\n\n    /// @notice Creates a new PBM token type using the provided data.\n    /// @param spotAmount Quantity of the underlying ERC-20 token that the PBM represents.\n    /// @param tokenExpiry Expiration timestamp specific to this PBM token type.\n    /// @param tokenURI URI pointing to metadata compliant with the Opensea NFT metadata standard.\n    /// @param postExpiryURI URI pointing to metadata for the expired PBM type, following the Opensea NFT metadata standard.\n    function createPBMTokenType(\n        uint256 spotAmount,\n        uint256 tokenExpiry,\n        string memory tokenURI,\n        string memory postExpiryURI\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Mints a new PBM instance, essentially creating a PBM account for the specified user. (userAddress->tokenId will be an unique identifier)\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type. (account_id)\n    /// @param amount Quantity of PBMs to be minted. When minting to a user directly this should always be 1. When minting to an orchestrator this could be more.\n    /// @param receiver Address to receive the minted PBMs.\n    function mint(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, address receiver) external;\n\n    /// @notice Mints multiple PBM instances in a batch for multiple receivers. Essentially creating a PBM account for the each specified user. (userAddress->tokenId will be an unique identifier)\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type. (account_id)\n    /// @param amount Quantity of PBMs to be minted for each receiver. When minting to a user directly this should always be 1. When minting to an orchestrator this could be more.\n    /// @param receivers List of addresses to receive the minted PBMs.\n    function mintBatch(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, address[] memory receivers) external;\n\n    /// @notice Adds the specified amount of underlying ERC-20 tokens to a user's specific PBM token id.\n    /// @notice Updates the user's wallet balance and available balance.\n    /// @notice Emits a FundsAdded event.\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type. (account_id)\n    /// @param spotAmount Quantity of underlying ERC-20 tokens to be added.\n    /// @param recipientAddress Address of the user whose balance is to be updated.\n    function addUserBalance(uint256 tokenId, uint256 spotAmount, address recipientAddress) external;\n\n    /// @notice Transfers a PBM without moving the underlying ERC20 tokens.\n    /// @param from Address sending the PBM.\n    /// @param to Address receiving the PBM.\n    /// @param id Identifier of the PBM token type being transferred.\n    /// @param amount Amount of underlying spotToken to be transferred. (can not be greater than the available balance)\n    /// @param data Optional additional data to accompany the transfer.\n    function safeTransferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 id, uint256 amount, bytes memory data) external;\n\n    /// @notice Batch transfers multiple PBMs without moving the underlying ERC20 tokens. This function is unlikely to be used.\n    /// @param from Address sending the PBMs.\n    /// @param to Address receiving the PBMs.\n    /// @param ids List of identifiers for the PBM token types being transferred.\n    /// @param amounts List of amounts of underlying spotToken to be transferred. (can not be greater than the available balance)\n    /// @param data Optional additional data to accompany the transfer.\n    function safeBatchTransferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256[] memory ids,\n        uint256[] memory amounts,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Creates order with the order_id, and how much this order_id cost.\n    /// @notice Escrows the user's currentBalance into the contract and update user availableBalance\n    /// @notice User needs to call setApprovalForAll() to approve the caller to create order on behalf of user\n    /// @param customerWalletAddr Address of the customer placing the order.\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type.\n    /// @param orderId Platform-generated identifier for the order.\n    /// @param orderValue Value of the order in underlying ERC-20 tokens.\n    /// @param fundDisbursementAddr Merchant address to receive the ERC-20 tokens upon order redemption.\n    function createOrder(\n        address customerWalletAddr,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        string memory orderId,\n        uint256 orderValue,\n        address fundDisbursementAddr\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Creates order for grab wallet user with the order_id, and how much this order_id cost.\n    /// @notice Escrows the user's currentBalance into the contract and update user availableBalance\n    /// @notice Burns the token after the order is created.\n    /// @param customerWalletAddr Address of the customer placing the order.\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type.\n    /// @param orderId Platform-generated identifier for the order.\n    /// @param orderValue Value of the order in underlying ERC-20 tokens.\n    /// @param fundDisbursementAddr Merchant address to receive the ERC-20 tokens upon order redemption.\n    function createOrderGrab(\n        address customerWalletAddr,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        string memory orderId,\n        uint256 orderValue,\n        address fundDisbursementAddr\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Cancels a pending order, refunding the ERC-20 token value to the customer.\n    /// @param orderId Platform-generated identifier for the order.\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type related to the order.\n    function cancelOrder(string memory orderId, uint256 tokenId) external;\n\n    /// @notice Redeems a pending order, releasing the ERC-20 token value to the specified merchant address.\n    /// @param orderId Platform-generated identifier for the order.\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type related to the order.\n    /// @param userWallet Address of the customer redeeming the order.\n    function redeemOrder(string memory orderId, uint256 tokenId, address userWallet) external;\n\n    /// @notice Fetches the balance details for a user for a specific PBM token.\n    /// @param user The address of the user whose balance is to be queried.\n    /// @param tokenId The identifier of the PBM token type.\n    /// @return userBalance The total wrapped erc20 token balance of the user for the specified PBM token.(walletBalance, availableBalance)\n    function getUserBalance(address user, uint256 tokenId) external view returns (UserBalance memory userBalance);\n\n    /// @notice Allows the PBM contract owner to claim the underlying ERC-20 tokens after they expire.\n    function revokePBM() external;\n\n    /// @notice Retrieves details of a specific PBM token type.\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type.\n    /// @return Amount of underlying ERC-20 tokens represented by the PBM.\n    /// @return Expiration timestamp specific to this PBM token type.\n    function getTokenDetails(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256, uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Retrieves the URI associated with a specific PBM token type.\n    /// @param tokenId Identifier of the PBM token type.\n    /// @return URI pointing to metadata compliant with the Opensea NFT metadata standard.\n    function uri(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (string memory);\n\n    /// @notice Emitted when a PBM's creator retrieves the ERC-20 tokens from expired PBMs.\n    /// @param beneficiary Address of the PBM creator receiving the ERC-20 tokens.\n    /// @param ERC20Token Address of the underlying ERC-20 token.\n    /// @param ERC20TokenValue Quantity of underlying ERC-20 tokens being transferred.\n    event PBMrevokeWithdraw(address beneficiary, address ERC20Token, uint256 ERC20TokenValue);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x3e213eb265cb8d86be97735178113f9dbc896ba0d950652c2cac22173b914d56","license":"GPL-2.0-or-later"},"contracts/IPBMTokenManager.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n/// @title PBMTokenManager Interface.\n/// @notice The PBMTokenManager is the stores details of the different data types.\ninterface IPBMTokenManager {\n    /// @notice Returns the URI (metadata) for the PBM with the corresponding tokenId\n    /// @param tokenId The id for the PBM in query\n    /// @return Returns the metadata URI for the PBM\n    function uri(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (string memory);\n\n    /// @notice Checks if tokens Ids have been created and are not expired\n    /// @param tokenIds The ids for the PBM in query\n    /// @return Returns true if all the tokenId are valid else false\n    function areTokensValid(uint256[] memory tokenIds) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /// @notice gets the amount of underlying ERC20 tokens each of the the PBM type holds\n    /// @param tokenId The id for the PBM in query\n    /// @return Returns the initial ERC20 balance of the PBM account\n    function getTokenValue(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Retreive the details for a PBM\n    /// @param tokenId The id for the PBM in query\n    /// @return spotAmount Amount of underlying ERC20 held by the each of the PBM token\n    /// @return expiry  Expiry time (in epoch) for the PBM type\n    function getTokenDetails(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256 spotAmount, uint256 expiry);\n\n    /// @notice Creates a PBM token type, with all its necessary details\n    /// @param spotAmount The number of ERC-20 tokens that is used as the underlying currency for PBM\n    /// @param tokenExpiry The expiry date (in epoch) of th PBM type\n    /// @param tokenURI the URI containting the metadata (opensea standard for ERC1155) for the  PBM type\n    /// @param postExpiryURI the URI containting the metadata (opensea standard for ERC1155) for the expired PBM type\n    /// @param contractExpiry the expiry time (in epoch) for the overall PBM contract\n    function createTokenType(\n        uint256 spotAmount,\n        uint256 tokenExpiry,\n        string memory tokenURI,\n        string memory postExpiryURI,\n        uint256 contractExpiry\n    ) external;\n\n    /// @notice Event emitted when a new PBM token type is created\n    /// @param tokenId The account from which the tokens were sent, i.e. the balance decreased\n    /// @param amount The amount of tokens that were transferred\n    /// @param expiry The time (in epoch) when the PBM type will expire\n    event NewPBMTypeCreated(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, uint256 expiry);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xd0c2d7e8183f1fe4a012a9c96e9a82f313c2eede0b0193ad3f8b0f45f90aaa08","license":"MIT"},"contracts/NoDelegateCall.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n/// @title Prevents delegatecall to a contract\n/// @notice Base contract that provides a modifier for preventing delegatecall to methods in a child contract\nabstract contract NoDelegateCall {\n    /// @dev The original address of this contract\n    address private immutable original;\n\n    constructor() {\n        // Immutables are computed in the init code of the contract, and then inlined into the deployed bytecode.\n        // In other words, this variable won't change when it's checked at runtime.\n        original = address(this);\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Private method is used instead of inlining into modifier because modifiers are copied into each method,\n    ///     and the use of immutable means the address bytes are copied in every place the modifier is used.\n    function checkNotDelegateCall() private view {\n        require(address(this) == original, \"Delegate calls restricted\");\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Prevents delegatecall into the modified method\n    modifier noDelegateCall() {\n        checkNotDelegateCall();\n        _;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x11bd3eb59d1d1d8ed1098972ee376ac3d9846b8a21b896b25811cdc3b5d61a2e","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/PBM.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.7;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/security/Pausable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/security/ReentrancyGuard.sol\";\n\nimport \"./ERC20Helper.sol\";\nimport \"./PBMTokenManager.sol\";\nimport \"./IPBM.sol\";\n\ncontract PBM is ERC1155, Ownable, Pausable, ReentrancyGuard, IPBM {\n    // undelrying ERC-20 tokens\n    address public spotToken = address(0);\n    // address of the token manager\n    address public pbmTokenManager = address(0);\n\n    // tracks contract initialisation\n    bool internal initialised = false;\n    // time of expiry ( epoch )\n    uint256 public contractExpiry;\n\n    constructor() ERC1155(\"\") {\n        pbmTokenManager = address(new PBMTokenManager());\n    }\n\n    function initialise(address _spotToken, uint256 _expiry) external override onlyOwner {\n        require(!initialised, \"PBM: Already initialised\");\n        require(Address.isContract(_spotToken), \"Invalid spot token\");\n        spotToken = _spotToken;\n        contractExpiry = _expiry;\n        initialised = true;\n    }\n\n    enum OrderStatus {\n        PENDING,\n        REDEEMED,\n        CANCELLED\n    }\n\n    struct Order {\n        uint256 orderValue; // how much this order cost.\n        string orderId;\n        address customerWallet;\n        address fundDisbursementAddress; // need this to check upon redemption\n        OrderStatus status;\n    }\n\n    // user_address -> token_id -> UserBalance\n    // token_id being the account number\n    // user_address is the user\u2019s identifier\n    mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => UserBalance)) private userBalances;\n\n    function getUserBalance(\n        address user,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) public view whenNotPaused returns (UserBalance memory userBalance) {\n        UserBalance memory userBal = userBalances[user][tokenId];\n        return userBal;\n    }\n\n    // order id hash => order mapping\n    mapping(bytes32 => Order) public orders;\n\n    // whitelist mapping\n    mapping(address => bool) public whitelist;\n\n    modifier onlyWhitelisted() {\n        require(whitelist[_msgSender()], \"You are not authorized to call this function\");\n        _;\n    }\n\n    modifier orderExists(string memory orderId) {\n        bytes32 orderIdHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(orderId));\n        require(orders[orderIdHash].orderValue > 0, \"Order with this ID does not exist\");\n        _;\n    }\n\n    function addToWhitelist(address account) external onlyOwner {\n        whitelist[account] = true;\n    }\n\n    function removeFromWhitelist(address account) external onlyOwner {\n        whitelist[account] = false;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-createOrder}.\n     *\n     * Note: user needs to call setApprovalForAll() to approve the caller to create order on behalf of user\n\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - caller must be token owner or approved to create order on behalf of user\n     * - `customerWalletAddr` must not be the zero address.\n     * - `fundDisbursementAddr` must not be the zero address.\n     * - `orderValue` must be greater than 0\n     * - `orderId` must be unique\n     * - user must have sufficient available balance\n     * - contract must not be paused\n     */\n    function createOrder(\n        address customerWalletAddr,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        string memory orderId,\n        uint256 orderValue,\n        address fundDisbursementAddr\n    ) external whenNotPaused {\n        require(\n            customerWalletAddr == _msgSender() || isApprovedForAll(customerWalletAddr, _msgSender()),\n            \"Caller is not token owner or approved to create order on behalf of user\"\n        );\n        _createOrder(customerWalletAddr, tokenId, orderId, orderValue, fundDisbursementAddr);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-createOrderGrab}.\n     *\n     * Note: createOrderGrab doesn't require user approval to create order on behalf of user\n     *       instead if can only be called by whitelisted wallets\n\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - only whitelisted wallets can call this function\n     * - `customerWalletAddr` must not be the zero address.\n     * - `fundDisbursementAddr` must not be the zero address.\n     * - `orderValue` must be greater than 0\n     * - `orderId` must be unique\n     * - user must have sufficient available balance\n     * - contract must not be paused\n     */\n    function createOrderGrab(\n        address grabWalletAddr,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        string memory orderId,\n        uint256 orderValue,\n        address fundDisbursementAddr\n    ) external whenNotPaused onlyWhitelisted {\n        _createOrder(grabWalletAddr, tokenId, orderId, orderValue, fundDisbursementAddr);\n    }\n\n    function _createOrder(\n        address walletAddr,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        string memory orderId,\n        uint256 orderValue,\n        address fundDisbursementAddr\n    ) private {\n        require(walletAddr != address(0), \"Invalid customer address\");\n        require(orderValue > 0, \"Invalid order value\");\n        require(fundDisbursementAddr != address(0), \"Invalid fund disbursement address\");\n\n        bytes32 orderIdHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(orderId));\n        require(orders[orderIdHash].orderValue == 0, \"Order with this ID already exists\");\n\n        UserBalance storage userBalance = userBalances[walletAddr][tokenId];\n        require(userBalance.availableBalance >= orderValue, \"Insufficient available funds\");\n\n        orders[orderIdHash] = Order(orderValue, orderId, walletAddr, fundDisbursementAddr, OrderStatus.PENDING);\n\n        userBalance.availableBalance -= orderValue;\n\n        emit OrderCreated(walletAddr, orderId, orderValue, fundDisbursementAddr);\n    }\n\n    function cancelOrder(\n        string memory orderId,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) external whenNotPaused onlyWhitelisted orderExists(orderId) {\n        bytes32 orderIdHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(orderId));\n        require(orders[orderIdHash].status == OrderStatus.PENDING, \"This order is no longer pending\");\n        uint256 order_value = orders[orderIdHash].orderValue;\n\n        UserBalance storage userBalance = userBalances[orders[orderIdHash].customerWallet][tokenId];\n        require(\n            userBalance.walletBalance >= (userBalance.availableBalance + order_value),\n            \"Avail balance can never be greater than walletBalance\"\n        );\n        require(userBalance.walletBalance > 0, \"Invalid user balance.\");\n\n        // increase the availableBalance.\n        // essentially in pay and cancel pay, we only touch the availableBalance.\n        // wallet balance is only edited in the event of p2p transfer, or successful redeem.\n        orders[orderIdHash].status = OrderStatus.CANCELLED;\n        userBalance.availableBalance += order_value;\n        emit OrderCanceled(orderId);\n    }\n\n    // update order status\n    // credit merchant wallet\n    // TBD: do we need to check if fundDisbursementAddress is a merchant?\n    function redeemOrder(\n        string memory orderId,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        address userWallet\n    ) external whenNotPaused onlyWhitelisted orderExists(orderId) {\n        bytes32 orderIdHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(orderId));\n        // this check is very important, to prevent this function() from being called more than once.\n        require(orders[orderIdHash].status == OrderStatus.PENDING, \"This order is no longer pending\");\n        uint256 order_value = orders[orderIdHash].orderValue;\n        UserBalance storage userBalance = userBalances[userWallet][tokenId];\n        require(userBalance.walletBalance >= order_value, \"Insufficient wallet balance\");\n\n        require(\n            userBalance.walletBalance >= userBalance.availableBalance,\n            \"Something is wrong, availableBalance must be deducted first\"\n        );\n        userBalance.walletBalance -= order_value;\n\n        orders[orderIdHash].status = OrderStatus.REDEEMED;\n\n        ERC20Helper.safeTransfer(spotToken, orders[orderIdHash].fundDisbursementAddress, order_value);\n\n        // burn the token after order redemption\n        _burn(userWallet, tokenId, 1);\n        emit OrderRedeemed(userWallet, orderId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-createPBMTokenType}.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - caller must be owner\n     * - contract must not be expired\n     * - `tokenExpiry` must be less than contract expiry\n     * - `amount` should not be 0\n     */\n\n    function createPBMTokenType(\n        uint256 spotAmount,\n        uint256 tokenExpiry,\n        string memory tokenURI,\n        string memory postExpiryURI\n    ) external override onlyOwner {\n        PBMTokenManager(pbmTokenManager).createTokenType(\n            spotAmount,\n            tokenExpiry,\n            tokenURI,\n            postExpiryURI,\n            contractExpiry\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-mint}.\n     *\n     *  WARNING: Any contracts that externally call these mint() and batchMint() functions should implement some sort of reentrancy guard procedure (such as OpenZeppelin's ReentrancyGuard).\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - contract must not be paused\n     * - tokens must not be expired\n     * - `tokenId` should be a valid id that has already been created\n     * - when recipient is not whitelisted and does not have the token id, the amount should be 1\n     */\n\n    function mint(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, address recipientAddress) public override whenNotPaused onlyOwner {\n        // do we need to check whether user address already holds the account/tokenId?\n        // block mint to user alr holds the account/tokenId\n        require(recipientAddress != address(0), \"Invalid user address\");\n        require(\n            balanceOf(recipientAddress, tokenId) == 0 || whitelist[recipientAddress] == true,\n            \"Recipient address is not whitelisted or already holds this account\"\n        );\n\n        _mint(recipientAddress, tokenId, amount, \"\");\n    }\n\n    // instead of minting multiple token ids to a single address\n    // mintBatch here would mint one token id (account) to multiple user addresses\n    function mintBatch(\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 amount,\n        address[] memory recipientAddresses\n    ) public whenNotPaused onlyOwner {\n        uint256 recipientCount = recipientAddresses.length;\n\n        // Loop over each address and mint\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < recipientCount; i++) {\n            address recipientAddress = recipientAddresses[i];\n            require(recipientAddress != address(0), \"Invalid recipient address\");\n            require(\n                balanceOf(recipientAddress, tokenId) == 0 || whitelist[recipientAddress] == true,\n                \"Recipient address is not whitelisted or already holds this account\"\n            );\n            _mint(recipientAddress, tokenId, amount, \"\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-addUserBalance}.\n     *\n     *  WARNING: Any contracts that externally call these mint() and batchMint() functions should implement some sort of reentrancy guard procedure (such as OpenZeppelin's ReentrancyGuard).\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - contract must not be paused\n     * - tokens must not be expired\n     * - `tokenId` should be a valid id that has already been created\n     * - recipient should have the token id\n     * - `spotAmount` should be greater than 0\n     */\n    // spotAmount is the amount of spotToken to be transferred from caller to this contract\n    // spotAmount = walletBalance * amountOfUserAddresses\n    function addUserBalance(\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 spotAmount,\n        address recipientAddress\n    ) external whenNotPaused onlyOwner {\n        require(recipientAddress != address(0), \"Invalid recipient address\");\n        require(spotAmount > 0, \"Invalid spot amount\");\n        require(balanceOf(recipientAddress, tokenId) > 0, \"Recipient does not have the token id\");\n        // transfer spotToken from caller to this contract\n        ERC20Helper.safeTransferFrom(spotToken, _msgSender(), address(this), spotAmount);\n\n        // update user balance\n        UserBalance storage userBalance = userBalances[recipientAddress][tokenId];\n        userBalance.walletBalance += spotAmount;\n        userBalance.availableBalance += spotAmount;\n        emit FundsAdded(recipientAddress, spotAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-safeTransferFrom}.\n     *\n     * IMPT: This function doesn't actually transfer the underlying ERC20 tokens. Instead, it only updates the user balances within this contract.\n     *       And should only be used for whitelisted wallets to airdrop to user wallets.\n     * Note:\n     *\n     * 1) orchestrator to airdrop to user addresses\n     * 2) P2P transfer is disabled for non whitelisted wallets\n     *\n     * - transferAmount here is the amount of underlying ERC20 tokens instead of the amount of PBM tokens\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - contract must not be paused.\n     * - `transferAmount` in the _safeTransferFrom should be exactly 10 and is referring to underlying ERC20 token.\n     * - sender (`from` address) should have a positive available balance.\n     * - recipient (`to` address) should not be the zero address.\n     * - caller must be whitelisted.\n     */\n    function safeTransferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 transferAmount,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) public override(ERC1155, IPBM) whenNotPaused onlyWhitelisted nonReentrant {\n        require(to != address(0), \"Invalid recipient address\");\n        require(from == _msgSender() || isApprovedForAll(from, _msgSender()), \"Caller is not token owner or approved\");\n        require(userBalances[from][tokenId].availableBalance >= transferAmount, \"Invalid available balance\");\n        // redundant check\n        require(userBalances[from][tokenId].walletBalance >= transferAmount, \"Invalid wallet balance\");\n\n        // if to user has no token id and from user is whitelisted call _safeTransferFrom and update userBalances\n        if (balanceOf(to, tokenId) == 0) {\n            _safeTransferFrom(from, to, tokenId, 1, data);\n        }\n        updateUserBalances(from, to, tokenId, transferAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-safeBatchTransferFrom}.\n     *\n     * IMPT: This function doesn't actually transfer the underlying ERC20 tokens. Instead, it only updates the user balances within this contract.\n     *\n     * Note:\n     * - this function is very unlikely to be used.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - contract must not be paused.\n     * - sender (`from` address) should have a positive available balance for each tokenId.\n     * - recipient (`to` address) should not be the zero address.\n     * - caller must be whitelisted.\n     */\n    function safeBatchTransferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n        uint256[] memory transferAmounts,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) public override(ERC1155, IPBM) whenNotPaused onlyWhitelisted nonReentrant {\n        require(to != address(0), \"Invalid recipient address\");\n        require(from == _msgSender() || isApprovedForAll(from, _msgSender()), \"Caller is not token owner or approved\");\n        require(tokenIds.length == transferAmounts.length, \"TokenIDs and amounts length mismatch\");\n\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < tokenIds.length; i++) {\n            uint256 tokenId = tokenIds[i];\n            uint256 transferAmount = transferAmounts[i];\n            require(userBalances[from][tokenId].availableBalance >= transferAmount, \"Invalid available balance\");\n            require(userBalances[from][tokenId].walletBalance >= transferAmount, \"Invalid wallet balance\");\n\n            // if to user has no token id and from user is whitelisted call _safeTransferFrom and update userBalances\n            if (balanceOf(to, tokenId) == 0) {\n                _safeTransferFrom(from, to, tokenId, 1, data);\n            }\n            updateUserBalances(from, to, tokenId, transferAmount);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function updateUserBalances(address from, address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 transferAmount) private {\n        userBalances[from][tokenId].walletBalance -= transferAmount;\n        userBalances[from][tokenId].availableBalance -= transferAmount;\n\n        userBalances[to][tokenId].walletBalance += transferAmount;\n        userBalances[to][tokenId].availableBalance += transferAmount;\n\n        emit UserBalanceUpdated(\n            from,\n            tokenId,\n            userBalances[from][tokenId].walletBalance,\n            userBalances[from][tokenId].availableBalance\n        );\n        emit UserBalanceUpdated(\n            to,\n            tokenId,\n            userBalances[to][tokenId].walletBalance,\n            userBalances[to][tokenId].availableBalance\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-revokePBM}.\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - caller must be the owner of the contract\n     * - token must be expired\n     */\n\n    function revokePBM() external onlyOwner whenNotPaused {\n        ERC20 erc20 = ERC20(spotToken);\n        uint256 valueOfTokens = erc20.balanceOf(address(this));\n        ERC20Helper.safeTransfer(address(erc20), owner(), valueOfTokens);\n\n        emit PBMrevokeWithdraw(_msgSender(), spotToken, valueOfTokens);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-getTokenDetails}.\n     *\n     */\n    function getTokenDetails(uint256 tokenId) external view override returns (uint256, uint256) {\n        return PBMTokenManager(pbmTokenManager).getTokenDetails(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBM-uri}.\n     *\n     */\n    function uri(uint256 tokenId) public view override(ERC1155, IPBM) returns (string memory) {\n        return PBMTokenManager(pbmTokenManager).uri(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev see {Pausable _pause}\n     *\n     * Requirements :\n     * - caller should be owner\n     */\n    function pause() external onlyOwner {\n        _pause();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev see {Pausable _unpause}\n     *\n     * Requirements :\n     * - caller should be owner\n     */\n    function unpause() external onlyOwner {\n        _unpause();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Allows the owner to burn `amount` of tokens of `id` from `account`.\n     * `amount` here typically would be 1.\n     */\n    function adminBurn(address account, uint256 id, uint256 amount) external onlyOwner {\n        _burn(account, id, amount);\n    }\n\n    // @dev recoverAllERC20 is a function to recover all the balance of a specific ERC20 token from the PBM contract\n    // @param _token ERC20 token address\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    function recoverAllERC20(address _token) public onlyOwner {\n        ERC20 erc20 = ERC20(_token);\n        ERC20Helper.safeTransfer(address(erc20), owner(), erc20.balanceOf(address(this)));\n    }\n\n    // @dev recoverERC20 is a function to recover specific amount of a ERC20 token from the PBM contract\n    // @param _token ERC20 token address\n    // @param amount amount of ERC20 token to recover\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    function recoverERC20(address _token, uint256 amount) public onlyOwner {\n        ERC20 erc20 = ERC20(_token);\n        ERC20Helper.safeTransfer(address(erc20), owner(), amount);\n    }\n\n    // @dev see { PBMTokenManager - updateTokenExpiry}\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    function updateTokenExpiry(uint256 tokenId, uint256 expiry) external onlyOwner {\n        PBMTokenManager(pbmTokenManager).updateTokenExpiry(tokenId, expiry);\n    }\n\n    // @dev see { PBMTokenManager - updateTokenURI}\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    function updateTokenURI(uint256 tokenId, string memory tokenURI) external onlyOwner {\n        PBMTokenManager(pbmTokenManager).updateTokenURI(tokenId, tokenURI);\n        emit MetadataUpdated(tokenId, tokenURI);\n    }\n\n    // @dev see { PBMTokenManager - updatePostExpiryURI}\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    function updatePostExpiryURI(uint256 tokenId, string memory postExpiryURI) external onlyOwner {\n        PBMTokenManager(pbmTokenManager).updatePostExpiryURI(tokenId, postExpiryURI);\n        emit PostExpiryMetadataUpdated(tokenId, postExpiryURI);\n    }\n\n    event OrderCreated(address customer, string orderId, uint256 orderValue, address fundDisbursementAddress);\n    event OrderRedeemed(address customer, string orderId);\n    event OrderCanceled(string orderId);\n    event FundsAdded(address customer, uint256 spotAmount);\n    event UserBalanceUpdated(\n        address indexed user,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 newWalletBalance,\n        uint256 newAvailableBalance\n    );\n    event MetadataUpdated(uint256 tokenId, string uri);\n    event PostExpiryMetadataUpdated(uint256 tokenId, string uri);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x9fdcf6c6b4c0f911f23a7ee95a1a9bd38e806d5a3366898e20a32c6204390b2e","license":"MIT"},"contracts/PBMTokenManager.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nimport \"./IPBMTokenManager.sol\";\nimport \"./NoDelegateCall.sol\";\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Strings.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol\";\n\ncontract PBMTokenManager is Ownable, IPBMTokenManager, NoDelegateCall {\n    using Strings for uint256;\n\n    // counter used to create new token types\n    uint256 internal tokenTypeCount = 1;\n\n    // structure representing all the details of a PBM type\n    struct TokenConfig {\n        uint256 amount;\n        uint256 expiry;\n        string uri;\n        string postExpiryURI;\n    }\n\n    // mapping of token ids to token details\n    mapping(uint256 => TokenConfig) internal tokenTypes;\n\n    constructor() {}\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBMTokenManager-createPBMTokenType}.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - caller must be owner ( PBM contract )\n     * - contract must not be expired\n     * - token expiry must be less than contract expiry\n     * - `amount` should not be 0\n     */\n    function createTokenType(\n        uint256 spotAmount,\n        uint256 tokenExpiry,\n        string memory tokenURI,\n        string memory postExpiryURI,\n        uint256 contractExpiry\n    ) external override onlyOwner noDelegateCall {\n        require(tokenExpiry <= contractExpiry, \"Invalid token expiry-1\");\n        require(tokenExpiry > block.timestamp, \"Invalid token expiry-2\");\n        require(spotAmount != 0, \"Spot amount is 0\");\n\n        tokenTypes[tokenTypeCount].amount = spotAmount;\n        tokenTypes[tokenTypeCount].expiry = tokenExpiry;\n        tokenTypes[tokenTypeCount].uri = tokenURI;\n        tokenTypes[tokenTypeCount].postExpiryURI = postExpiryURI;\n\n        emit NewPBMTypeCreated(tokenTypeCount, spotAmount, tokenExpiry);\n        tokenTypeCount += 1;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBMTokenManager-getTokenValue}.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - `tokenId` should be a valid id that has already been created\n     */\n    function getTokenValue(uint256 tokenId) external view override returns (uint256) {\n        require(\n            tokenTypes[tokenId].amount != 0 && block.timestamp < tokenTypes[tokenId].expiry,\n            \"PBM: Invalid Token Id(s)\"\n        );\n        return tokenTypes[tokenId].amount;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBMTokenManager-uri}.\n     *\n     */\n    function uri(uint256 tokenId) external view override returns (string memory) {\n        if (block.timestamp >= tokenTypes[tokenId].expiry) {\n            return tokenTypes[tokenId].postExpiryURI;\n        }\n        return tokenTypes[tokenId].uri;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBMTokenManager-areTokensValid}.\n     *\n     */\n    function areTokensValid(uint256[] memory tokenIds) external view override returns (bool) {\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < tokenIds.length; i++) {\n            if (block.timestamp > tokenTypes[tokenIds[i]].expiry || tokenTypes[tokenIds[i]].amount == 0) {\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        return true;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IPBMTokenManager-getTokenDetails}.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - `tokenId` should be a valid id that has already been created\n     */\n    function getTokenDetails(uint256 tokenId) external view override returns (uint256, uint256) {\n        require(tokenTypes[tokenId].amount != 0, \"PBM: Invalid Token Id(s)\");\n        return (tokenTypes[tokenId].amount, tokenTypes[tokenId].expiry);\n    }\n\n    // @dev updateTokenExpiry allows the owner to update the expiry of an existing token type\n    // @param tokenId tokenId of the token type to update the expiry\n    // @param expiry new expiry to update to\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    // - provided tokenId should be valid (less than the tokenTypeCount)\n    // @notice if we call this function to update the expiry we also need to update the metadata json\n    function updateTokenExpiry(uint256 tokenId, uint256 expiry) external onlyOwner {\n        require(tokenId < tokenTypeCount, \"Invalid tokenId\");\n        tokenTypes[tokenId].expiry = expiry;\n    }\n\n    // @dev updateTokenURI allows the owner to update the metadata URL of an existing token type\n    // @param tokenId tokenId of the token type to update the expiry\n    // @param uri new metadata URL\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    // - provided tokenId should be valid (less than the tokenTypeCount)\n    function updateTokenURI(uint256 tokenId, string memory tokenURI) external onlyOwner {\n        require(tokenId < tokenTypeCount, \"Invalid tokenId\");\n        tokenTypes[tokenId].uri = tokenURI;\n    }\n\n    // @dev updatePostExpiryURI allows the owner to update the post expiry metadata URL of an existing token type\n    // @param tokenId tokenId of the token type to update the expiry\n    // @param postExpiryURI new post expiry metadata URL\n    // requirements:\n    // - caller must be the owner\n    // - provided tokenId should be valid (less than the tokenTypeCount)\n    function updatePostExpiryURI(uint256 tokenId, string memory postExpiryURI) external onlyOwner {\n        require(tokenId < tokenTypeCount, \"Invalid tokenId\");\n        tokenTypes[tokenId].postExpiryURI = postExpiryURI;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x4ae0a5de73d0a3133fd6ece3bf8f46402d5b307cee877f3b1737b4fcb4525aaa","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

addUserBalance(uint256,uint256,address).details: See {IPBM-addUserBalance}.  WARNING: Any contracts that externally call these mint() and batchMint() functions should implement some sort of reentrancy guard procedure (such as OpenZeppelin's ReentrancyGuard). Requirements: - contract must not be paused - tokens must not be expired - `tokenId` should be a valid id that has already been created - recipient should have the token id - `spotAmount` should be greater than 0

adminBurn(address,uint256,uint256).details: Allows the owner to burn `amount` of tokens of `id` from `account`. `amount` here typically would be 1.

balanceOf(address,uint256).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOf}. Requirements: - `account` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

params.tokenId: Identifier of the PBM token type related to the order.

createOrder(address,uint256,string,uint2.details: See {IPBM-createOrder}. Note: user needs to call setApprovalForAll() to approve the caller to create order on behalf of user Requirements: - caller must be token owner or approved to create order on behalf of user - `customerWalletAddr` must not be the zero address. - `fundDisbursementAddr` must not be the zero address. - `orderValue` must be greater than 0 - `orderId` must be unique - user must have sufficient available balance - contract must not be paused

createOrderGrab(address,uint256,string,u.details: See {IPBM-createOrderGrab}. Note: createOrderGrab doesn't require user approval to create order on behalf of user       instead if can only be called by whitelisted wallets Requirements: - only whitelisted wallets can call this function - `customerWalletAddr` must not be the zero address. - `fundDisbursementAddr` must not be the zero address. - `orderValue` must be greater than 0 - `orderId` must be unique - user must have sufficient available balance - contract must not be paused

createPBMTokenType(uint256,uint256,strin.details: See {IPBM-createPBMTokenType}. Requirements: - caller must be owner - contract must not be expired - `tokenExpiry` must be less than contract expiry - `amount` should not be 0

params._spotToken: The address of the underlying ERC20 token.

mint(uint256,uint256,address).details: See {IPBM-mint}. Requirements: - contract must not be paused - tokens must not be expired - `tokenId` should be a valid id that has already been created - when recipient is not whitelisted and does not have the token id, the amount should be 1

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: see {Pausable _pause} Requirements : - caller should be owner

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.tokenId: Identifier of the PBM token type related to the order.
params.userWallet: Address of the customer redeeming the order.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revokePBM().details: See {IPBM-revokePBM}. Requirements: - caller must be the owner of the contract - token must be expired

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.details: See {IPBM-safeBatchTransferFrom}. IMPT: This function doesn't actually transfer the underlying ERC20 tokens. Instead, it only updates the user balances within this contract. Note: - this function is very unlikely to be used. Requirements: - contract must not be paused. - sender (`from` address) should have a positive available balance for each tokenId. - recipient (`to` address) should not be the zero address. - caller must be whitelisted.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: See {IPBM-safeTransferFrom}. IMPT: This function doesn't actually transfer the underlying ERC20 tokens. Instead, it only updates the user balances within this contract.       And should only be used for whitelisted wallets to airdrop to user wallets. Note: 1) orchestrator to airdrop to user addresses 2) P2P transfer is disabled for non whitelisted wallets - transferAmount here is the amount of underlying ERC20 tokens instead of the amount of PBM tokens Requirements: - contract must not be paused. - `transferAmount` in the _safeTransferFrom should be exactly 10 and is referring to underlying ERC20 token. - sender (`from` address) should have a positive available balance. - recipient (`to` address) should not be the zero address. - caller must be whitelisted.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: see {Pausable _unpause} Requirements : - caller should be owner

PBMrevokeWithdraw(address,address,uint25.notice: Emitted when a PBM's creator retrieves the ERC-20 tokens from expired PBMs.

cancelOrder(string,uint256).notice: Cancels a pending order, refunding the ERC-20 token value to the customer.

getUserBalance(address,uint256).notice: Fetches the balance details for a user for a specific PBM token.

initialise(address,uint256).notice: Initializes the contract with the address of the underlying ERC20 token, contract expiration, and the PBM address list.

redeemOrder(string,uint256,address).notice: Redeems a pending order, releasing the ERC-20 token value to the specified merchant address.
